item.title: Whats wrong with my code? C++
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

la­wl:

plz either use c++ strings for everything or use c strings (char[]) for everything

This is definitely what you need to do.

But to just make what you have compile, add the following includes:

#include <stdlib.h> #include <stdio.h> #include <iostream> #include <cstring>

And change each of these lines:

char command [80];
char input [70];
driver(&input,&c);

Into these:

char *command = new char[80];
char *input = new char[70];
driver(input,&c);

And it will compile and run, although not correctly. Change your program to do what lawl says.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with my code? C++
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

the entire code:: i changed name of variables (sorry).

for better reading:: http://pastebin.com/00fYm94U

[code]#include

using namespace std;

//#################################################
// THE FUNCTIONS

void fun_new (int k)

{

        if (( k <= 99999)&(k >= 0))
        {
            printf("New: %05d\n", k);
        }
        if (k < 0)
        {
            //cout << "Error: " << k << " is negative" <<endl;
            printf("Error: %05d is negative\n", k);

        }
        if (k > 99999)
        {
            //cout << "Error: " << k << " is too large" <<endl;
            printf("Error: %05d is too large\n", k);
        }

}

/*##################################################################33
Function to drive all functions
*/

void driver( char *commando, int *p)
// TEST CASE TO CHECK FOR
{
char omg [80] = “new”;
if (!strcmp(commando, “new”))
{
fun_new(*p);
}
else
cout << “error”<<endl;

}

//##############################################################################
// MAIN PROGRAM

int main()
{

   string ok = "new";
   string locate = "locate";
   string updatename = "updatename";
   string updatedivision = "updatedivision";
   string todelete = "delete";
   string printall = "printall";
   string deleteall = "deleteall";

char command [80];
int i = 1;
char input [70];

for (cin >> command; !cin.eof(); cin >> command)
{
while(i==1)
{

    i = i-1;

    strcpy(input,command);
    
}

int c =  i = atoi (command);

driver(&input,&c);

}

return 0;
}[/code]

thus envoking this::

the function is::

void check_fun( char *c, int *p)
// TEST CASE TO CHECK FOR
{
        
       if (!strcmp(command, "oui"))

            fun_dosomething(*p);
        }
        else
        cout << "error"<<endl;

}

the fun_dosomething is

void  fun_dosomething (int j)

{


            if (( j <= 3)&(j >= 0))
            {
                cout << "you are in the limit" << j <<endl;
            }
           else 
           {
              cout << "error"<<endl;

now when i compile i get error, thankyou in advance
